message.text: Actions job or workflow does not limit the permissions of the GITHUB_TOKEN. Consider setting an explicit permissions block, using the following as a minimal starting point: {{contents: read}}
Actions job or workflow does not limit the permissions of the GITHUB_TOKEN. Consider setting an explicit permissions block, using the following as a minimal starting point: {{contents: read}}

steps.name: Get the release version from the tag
steps.run:
# See: https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Actions/How-to-get-just-the-tag-name/m-p/32167/highlight/true#M1027
echo "RELEASE_VERSION=${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
echo "version is: ${{ env.RELEASE_VERSION }}"

steps.name: Generate Release Notes
steps.run:
./.github/workflows/release-notes.py --tag ${{ env.RELEASE_VERSION }} --output notes-${{ env.RELEASE_VERSION }}.md
cat notes-${{ env.RELEASE_VERSION }}.md

steps.name: Install packages (Ubuntu)
steps.run:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends xz-utils liblz4-tool musl-tools

steps.name: Build release binary
steps.run: cargo build --target ${{ matrix.target }} --verbose --release

steps.name: Build archive
steps.run:
outdir="./target/${{ env.TARGET_DIR }}/release"
staging="${{ env.BIN_NAME }}-${{ needs.create-release.outputs.release_version }}-${{ matrix.target }}"
mkdir -p "$staging"/{complete,doc}
cp {README.md,LICENSE-*} "$staging/"
cp {CHANGELOG.md,docs/*} "$staging/doc/"
if [ "${{ matrix.os }}" = "windows-2019" ]; then
  cp "target/${{ matrix.target }}/release/${{ env.BIN_NAME }}.exe" "$staging/"
  cd "$staging"
  7z a "../$staging.zip" .
  echo "ASSET=$staging.zip" >> $GITHUB_ENV
else
  cp "target/${{ matrix.target }}/release/${{ env.BIN_NAME }}" "$staging/"
  tar czf "$staging.tar.gz" -C "$staging" .
  echo "ASSET=$staging.tar.gz" >> $GITHUB_ENV
fi

Actions job or workflow does not limit the permissions of the GITHUB_TOKEN. Consider setting an explicit permissions block, using the following as a minimal starting point: {{contents: read}}

steps.name: Get the release version from the tag
steps.run:
# See: https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Actions/How-to-get-just-the-tag-name/m-p/32167/highlight/true#M1027
echo "RELEASE_VERSION=${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
echo "version is: ${{ env.RELEASE_VERSION }}"

steps.name: Generate Release Notes
steps.run:
./.github/workflows/release-notes.py --tag ${{ env.RELEASE_VERSION }} --output notes-${{ env.RELEASE_VERSION }}.md
cat notes-${{ env.RELEASE_VERSION }}.md

steps.name: Install packages (Ubuntu)
steps.run:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends xz-utils liblz4-tool musl-tools

steps.name: Build release binary
steps.run: cargo build --target ${{ matrix.target }} --verbose --release

steps.name: Build archive
steps.run:
outdir="./target/${{ matrix.target }}/release"
staging="${{ env.BIN_NAME }}-${{ needs.create-release.outputs.release_version }}-${{ matrix.target }}"
mkdir -p "$staging"/{complete,doc}
cp {README.md,LICENSE-*} "$staging/"
cp {CHANGELOG.md,docs/*} "$staging/doc/"
if [ "${{ matrix.os }}" = "windows-2019" ]; then
  cp "target/${{ matrix.target }}/release/${{ env.BIN_NAME }}.exe" "$staging/"
  ls -l "$staging"
  cd "$staging"
  7z a "../$staging.zip" .
  echo "ASSET=$staging.zip" >> $GITHUB_ENV
else
  cp "target/${{ matrix.target }}/release/${{ env.BIN_NAME }}" "$staging/"
  ls -l "$staging"
  tar czf "$staging.tar.gz" -C "$staging" .
  echo "ASSET=$staging.tar.gz" >> $GITHUB_ENV
fi

steps.name: Get the release version from the tag
steps.run: echo "TAG=${{ github.ref_name }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

steps.name: Show the tag
steps.run: echo "tag is: $TAG"

steps.name: Generate Release Notes
steps.run:
./.github/workflows/release-notes.py --tag ${{ env.TAG }} --output notes-${{ env.ERSION }}.md
cat notes-${{ env.TAG }}.md

steps.name: Create GitHub release
steps.run: gh release create $TAG --verify-tag --draft --title $TAG --notes-file notes-${{ env.TAG }}.md

steps.run:

steps.run: gh release edit "${{ needs.create-release.outputs.tag }}" --draft=false

steps.name: Get the release version from the tag
steps.run: echo "TAG=${{ github.ref_name }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

steps.name: Show the tag
steps.run: echo "tag is: $TAG"

steps.name: Generate Release Notes
steps.run:
./.github/workflows/release-notes.py --tag ${{ env.TAG }} --output notes-${{ env.TAG }}.md
cat notes-${{ env.TAG }}.md

steps.name: Create GitHub release
steps.run: gh release create $TAG --verify-tag --draft --title $TAG --notes-file notes-${{ env.TAG }}.md

steps.name: Install packages (Ubuntu)
steps.run:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends xz-utils liblz4-tool musl-tools

steps.name: Build release binary
steps.run: cargo build --target ${{ matrix.target }} --verbose --release

steps.name: Build archive
steps.run:
outdir="./target/${{ matrix.target }}/release"
staging="${{ env.BIN_NAME }}-${{ needs.create-release.outputs.tag }}-${{ matrix.target }}"
mkdir -p "$staging"/doc
cp {README.md,LICENSE-*} "$staging/"
cp {CHANGELOG.md,docs/*} "$staging/doc/"
if [ "${{ matrix.os }}" = "windows-2019" ]; then
  cp "target/${{ matrix.target }}/release/${{ env.BIN_NAME }}.exe" "$staging/"
  ls -l "$staging"
  cd "$staging"
  7z a "../$staging.zip" .
  echo "ASSET=$staging.zip" >> $GITHUB_ENV
else
  cp "target/${{ matrix.target }}/release/${{ env.BIN_NAME }}" "$staging/"
  ls -l "$staging"
  tar czf "$staging.tar.gz" -C "$staging" .
  echo "ASSET=$staging.tar.gz" >> $GITHUB_ENV
fi

steps.name: Upload release archive
steps.run:
tag="${{ needs.create-release.outputs.tag }}"
gh release upload "$tag" ${{ env.ASSET }}

steps.name: Publish Release
steps.run: gh release edit "${{ needs.create-release.outputs.tag }}" --draft=false

steps.name: Get the release version from the tag
steps.run: echo "TAG=${{ github.ref_name }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

if [ "${{ matrix.os }}" = "windows-2022" ]; then

  cd "$staging"
  7z a "../$staging.zip" .

else
  cp "target/${{ matrix.target }}/release/${{ env.BIN_NAME }}" "$staging/"
  ls -l "$staging"
  tar czf "$staging.tar.gz" -C "$staging" .
  echo "ASSET=$staging.tar.gz" >> $GITHUB_ENV
fi

steps.name: Upload release archive
steps.run:
tag="${{ needs.create-release.outputs.tag }}"
gh release upload "$tag" ${{ env.ASSET }}

steps.name: Publish Release
steps.run: gh release edit "${{ needs.create-release.outputs.tag }}" --draft=false
